alert.note: Alert for Hemphill (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 9:14PM CDT until June 04 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Texas... Sweetwater Creek at Kelton 5N affecting Wheeler County. Canadian River at Canadian 2NE affecting Hemphill County. ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Texas... Palo Duro Creek at Spearman 6W affecting Hansford County. Salt Fork Of The Red River at Wellington 7N affecting Collingsworth County. For Sweetwater Creek...including Kelton 5N...elevated river levels are forecast. For the Canadian River...including Canadian 2NE...elevated river levels are forecast. For Palo Duro creek...including Spearman 6W...elevated river levels are occurring and elevated river levels are forecast. For the Salt Fork of the Red River...including Wellington 7N... elevated river levels are occurring and elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Canadian River at Canadian 2NE. * WHEN...From this evening to early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Minor overbank flooding of farm and ranch land occurs. No significant damage expected to occur. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM CDT Friday the stage was 3.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 7.1 feet tomorrow morning. - Action stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 1100 AM CDT.
